New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers matched the second-best start to a season in NBA history by reaching 15-0 with a 128-114 victory over Charlotte, becoming the fourth team in NBA history to open 15-0, and the longest in the Cavaliers' 55-year history
Key Match Events: Darius Garland had 25 points and 12 assists, Ty Jerome added 24 points, Evan Mobley scored 23 points and grabbed 11 rebounds, and Jarrett Allen contributed 21 points and 15 rebounds to help the Cavaliers win
Pre-Game Insights: Donovan Mitchell took the night off to rest after averaging 24.6 points, 4.4 rebounds and 4.1 assists for the Cavs during their perfect run
Post-Match Reflections: Darius Garland said 'Everybody is ready to play. It doesn't matter, one through 15. Everybody contributed. Everybody had a huge part in this win. That's just us. Just as a team effort'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win streak is already the longest in the Cavaliers' 55-year history, eclipsing three 13-win runs when LeBron James was with Cleveland, and they now trail only the record 24-0 start by the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors
Others: Charlotte's LaMelo Ball had 31 points and 12 assists in a losing cause
